javadoc: Records the current top of screen position of the viewer.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Construct a new viewer position with the given index, xOffset and yOffset.

params.name: index
params.comment: the index of the layout displayed at the top of the screen.

params.name: xOffset
params.comment: The horizontal scroll position (NOT CURRENTLY USED)

params.name: yOffset
params.comment:
the vertical position of the layout at the top of the screen.
 If the the layout is totally visible, then the yOffset will be 0. Otherwise,
 it will be  0 indicating that it begins above the top of the screen.

methods.javadoc: Returns the index of the item at the top of the screen.
methods.name: getIndexAsInt
methods.comment: Returns the index of the item at the top of the screen.

methods.javadoc: Returns the y coordinate of the layout at the top of the screen.
methods.name: getYOffset
methods.comment: Returns the y coordinate of the layout at the top of the screen.

name: ViewerPosition
comment: Records the current top of screen position of the viewer.
